primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus Christ, the Word made flesh and Creator of all waters, consciously and sovereignly undergoes the agony of thirst on the Cross to fulfill the divine plan of salvation for his lost sheep.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, knowing that all was now finished, said...
He is also consciously enacting it even from the Cross.
He is manifestly aware of his divine destiny.

object.identificatie: The fulfillment of God's purpose/Salvation of the 'lost sheep'
tekstueel_bewijs: accomplishing God's purposes and dying victorious
fulfilling his purpose according to the plan of God

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Divine Plan
tekstueel_bewijs: this charge I have received from my Father
planned in the mind of God from the beginning

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'lost sheep' / The Samaritan woman / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: dying... for the love of his lost sheep
whoever drinks of the water that I shall give... will never thirst
John goes to extra trouble to show how the psalm is fulfilled
helper.rol_van_god: God is Subject (Jesus as the Second Person of the Trinity)
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit in the inspiration of the fulfilled Scripture

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely physical dehydration but the 'dust of death' and the cosmic necessity of the sacrifice.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer/believer coming to Jesus to receive living water.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Samaritan Woman
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer's ability to drink (Secondary) is entirely dependent on Christ's thirsting/dying (Primary).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus... is also consciously enacting it.
He makes water gush from a barren rock.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Many of you will recognize some of it.

voorbeelden: this charge I have received from my Father
for the love of his lost sheep
knowing that all was now finished
manifestly aware of his divine destiny
I have power to lay it down
The One who commands the waters

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes Christ's 'Sovereign Control' (Pouvoir) and 'Knowledge' (Savoir) over his suffering, rather than a human 'Must' (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Jesus' thirst) to S1 (Living water for us) via the revelation that Jesus chooses S2 to provide S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The 'Thirst' of God (S2) is the source of the 'Water' of Man (S1).

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Jesus is the active Subject of almost all significant verbs. The hearer is positioned as the recipient of a gift, not the achiever of a task.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is in command, accomplishing God's purposes.
The water that I shall give... will become in that person a spring of water.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Samaritan woman is used as a foil for Christ's grace, not as a moral model to emulate.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is an objective work of Christ into which the believer is invited.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the physical thirst of the Cross to the spiritual water of John 4/7 is perfectly integrated via the actant of the 'Sovereign Word'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The One... from whose being flows the gift of the water of eternal life - this is the One who is dying of a terrible thirst on the Cross for the love of his lost sheep.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'spring of water welling up' is the endowment of competence to the believer.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Moderate to High; described as being 'lost sheep' and 'despised'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a strict theocentric actantial structure where Jesus is the Subject and the hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; it serves the 'Victorious Christ' theme of John.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'thirst' is sufficiently intensified as a cosmic burden.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's thirst) precedes and enables Ethics/Experience (Our drinking).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in Johnannine homiletics, keeping the focus entirely on the agency of the Word made flesh.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'thirst' imagery, semiotics reveals that Jesus is the Subject of the thirst, not a victim of it.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of 'oxos' to the functional role of Jesus as the 'Sender' of living water.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the 'Subject-switch' where the One who has the Object (Water) becomes the one who lacks it (Thirst) so the Receiver can have it.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarist' trap by focusing on Christ's unique divine competence.
